title: Wave Glider gas measurements for BELS
comment: A Liquid Robotics SV3-v300 Wave Glider equipped with sensors to measure PCO2, total dissolved gas, oxygen, water temperature and salinity, to collect data in association with the Bubble Exchange in the Labrador Sea study. Sensors were mounted on the float and the sub.

publication.publisher_name: Coastal Environmental Observation Technology and Research (CEOTR)

attribution.creator_name: Coastal Environmental Observation Technology and Research (CEOTR)
attribution.acknowledgement: The SV3 Wave Glider was prepared by the Coastal Environmental Observation Technology and Research (CEOTR) group (ceotr.ocean.dal.ca). Financial support for the deployment and operation of the glider was provided by the Ocean Tracking Network and the Ocean Frontier Institute.

program_info.agencies: Ocean Tracking Network, Ocean Frontier Institute

instrument.comment:
LRI GPSWaves software receives selected inputs from: the 1Hz GPS included with the Wave Glider system and a LORD Microstrain GPS-Aided Inertial Navigation System (GPS/INS) device.

LORD Microstrain serial number: 6251-4220.102124

data_logger.name: 3MPU SMC2
data_logger.comment:
3MPU for SV3-1071. Ports for: Debug, GPSWaves, RUDICS, GPCTD+DO, C3 pump, C3 sensor, ADCP, Expansion

SMC port forwarding currently set-up for port 30022

SMC software version 2.7.0 (as of July 2021)
